confession.seduction_context: Seduced when angry with her brother-in-law Demenge Pasquin Daviller because he was spending her sister's property and her own 'mal a propos'. Devil promised to end her 'fascheries' and make her rich.

witnesses.name: Lucie fille de Claudon Mihiel dit Battillot
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: cousin (daughter of Claude Batillot, accused's cousin)

testimony.quarrel_subject: Claudon had quarrels with witness's parents

testimony.threat_quote: allez vous en, vous me causez moult de mal

testimony.quarrel_subject: Claudon had quarrels with his wife Claude
testimony.threat_quote: qu'ilz n'y auroient guère de chance

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: after eating a gateau she gave him, 11 years ago

testimony.threat_quote: trop ingratte et qu'il devoit avoir ce qu'il avoit

witnesses.name: Alix femme du maire Laurent Laurent

testimony.quarrel_subject: Quarrelled and fought with Claudon after losing child

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: shortly after consoling conversation with Claudon

testimony.quarrel_subject: Quarrelled with both Claudon and her mother Mongeotte about death of animals

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 8 days after being touched by Claudon

testimony.quarrel_subject: Threw stone at her window; later beat her when he found her cows in his field
testimony.threat_quote: que de sa vie il n'auroit chance; que se seroit une chere batterie pour luy

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 5 years earlier, died suddenly after being touched by Claudon

testimony.quarrel_subject: Had often quarrelled with Claudon and beaten her
Several times scolded Claudon for making enemies and quarrelling with everyone

timeline.subject: Prévôt of Charmes
timeline.details: Statement that François Perin maintained his accusation against Claudon du Puy up to his execution. She was released until recall but began disposing of goods, so was arrested

timeline.subject: Claudon du Puy
timeline.details: First interrogation; confessed to being a witch, seduced 9 months earlier, attended sabbat

timeline.subject: Claudon du Puy
timeline.details: Second interrogation; repeated confessions, said she attended sabbat 3 times

timeline.subject: Claudon du Puy
timeline.details: PG des Vosges asks for question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Claudon du Puy
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture; refused to name accomplices

prior_accusations.context: François Perin maintained his accusation against Claudon du Puy up to the time when he was burned for witchcraft

notable_quotes.speaker: Lucie (witness 1, victim)
notable_quotes.french: allez vous en, vous me causez moult de mal
notable_quotes.english: Go away, you cause me much harm
notable_quotes.context: Said by sick girl to Claudon when she entered the room

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon du Puy (accused)
notable_quotes.french: qu'ilz n'y auroient guère de chance
notable_quotes.english: they would not have much luck/fortune
notable_quotes.context: Threat to Francois Marchal's wife Claude during quarrels 11 years earlier

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon du Puy (accused)
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle vouldroit avoir faict ses affaires naturelles dans leur lict, qu'ilz n'avoient guiere affaire d'aller prendre tel advis
notable_quotes.english: she would like to have defecated in their bed, they had no need to seek such advice
notable_quotes.context: Mocking response when Francois Marchal emptied his bed on curé's advice

notable_quotes.speaker: Mongeotte (Claudon's mother)
notable_quotes.context: Threat to Mengin Sauffroy after he accused them of killing his animals; two horses died soon after

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon du Puy (accused)
notable_quotes.french: que de sa vie il n'auroit chance
notable_quotes.english: that in his life he would have no luck
notable_quotes.context: Threat to Thomas Gerardin after he threw stone at her window

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon du Puy (accused)
notable_quotes.french: que se seroit une chere batterie pour luy
notable_quotes.english: that it would be a costly beating for him
notable_quotes.context: Threat to Thomas Gerardin after he beat her for having cows in his field

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon du Puy (accused)
notable_quotes.french: trop ingratte et qu'il devoit avoir ce qu'il avoit
notable_quotes.english: too ungrateful and that he should have what he had
notable_quotes.context: Said to several people about Nicolas Batillot

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon du Puy (accused)
notable_quotes.french: pense il qu'il soit des sorcieres
notable_quotes.english: does he think there are witches?
notable_quotes.context: Said in low voice when curé judged strange things found in bed were products of witchcraft

notable_quotes.speaker: Vincent Marchal (witness 19)
notable_quotes.french: que plusieurs fois il a tancé ladicte Claudon de ce qu'elle s'acqueroit des ennemis et se faisoit hayr d'un chacun par son babille, et querelle qu'elle prenoit avec tout le monde
notable_quotes.english: that several times he had scolded Claudon for making enemies and making herself hated by everyone through her chattering and quarrelling with everyone

economic_context.details: Claudon was angry with her brother-in-law Demenge Pasquin Daviller because he was spending her sister's property and her own 'mal a propos' (inappropriately). This anger was the context for her alleged seduction by the devil. After being released pending recall, she began disposing of her goods, raising suspicion. Her goods were worth 133 francs and property 470 francs.

harms_catalog.harm_description: Strange malady, could not speak for 3 days, expected to die, thought something like a rat was running over her bed
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Father suspected Claudon, with whom he had previously quarrelled
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Bewitched bed; cured by eating apple given by Claudon in name of God

harms_catalog.harm_description: Face injury from lace-making 'careau' thrown at her
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Claudon angry after quarrels with witness's parents

harms_catalog.harm_description: Same illness as above; bed found to contain strange things judged by curé to be products of witchcraft; given extreme unction
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Bewitched bed; noises like people dancing overhead heard during 3-night vigil

harms_catalog.harm_description: Same illness; girl pushed Claudon away saying she caused much harm
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Proximity; bewitched bed; noises in loft above room

harms_catalog.harm_description: Long and strange illness, despite several pilgrimages; no remedy from doctors
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Claudon had quarrels with his wife Claude, said they would not have much luck
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: 11 years before, when setting up household
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Became ill after eating a 'gateau' (cake) she gave him; strange things found in bed on curé's advice

harms_catalog.harm_description: Death of unspecified animals
Unwell for last three years
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: She said to several that he was 'too ungrateful and should have what he had'

harms_catalog.harm_description: Labour lasted 8 days, child born dead, unable to be baptised
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Claudon consoled her and told her to pray she would not be like miller's wife who had two stillborn children

harms_catalog.harm_description: Death of two horses
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Quarrelled with both and told them he suspected them of causing death of animals; Mongeotte replied he was 'not yet well'

harms_catalog.harm_description: 14-week illness which several judged to proceed from witchcraft
Suffering for 3 years
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Claudon beaten several times and called witch multiple times

harms_catalog.harm_description: Became ill when returned home, died 8 days later
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: One Sunday while preparing to play cards
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Touched Gerardin several times; witchcraft by touch

harms_catalog.harm_description: Strange illness lasting 12 weeks, threw out strange things
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Beat her when found her with cows in his field; she said 'it would be a costly beating for him'

harms_catalog.harm_description: Suddenly cried out and was carried off into corner of kitchen, said an animal had done this
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Witness was thinking of having her arrested, still convinced she was a witch

harms_catalog.harm_description: Illness; discussed with other ill women who all suspected Claudon
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Husband beaten her and called her witch

harms_catalog.harm_description: Blindness
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Speculation by third parties; Claudon was in house and said child was very ill

harms_catalog.harm_description: Lost animals
Died suddenly after being touched by Claudon
Same illness as described by witnesses 1-3
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Had often quarrelled with Claudon and beaten her
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Made pilgrimage to Bozemont on Claudon's advice but to no profit; advised by Jeannon (wife of Grand Colas) to empty bed

harms_catalog.harm_description: Killed by Claudon's own confession
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Used powder given by devil, then threw powder in fire

material_culture.context: Claudon told sick Lucie to ask for an apple in the name of God; after eating it she recovered speech. Later Claudon gave two apples to Lucie.
Lucie was making lace on a 'careau' when Claudon threw it in her face during a quarrel
Multiple witnesses described finding 'strange things' in beds that were judged to be products of witchcraft by curés; advised to empty beds or sell them
Francois Marchal became ill after eating a cake given to him by Claudon
Devil gave Claudon powder which she used to kill two of her own hens before throwing it in the fire
Bastienne (neighbor) had often been given pears by Claudon which she would rather not have had due to her reputation
After being released pending recall, Claudon began disposing of her goods, raising suspicion. Goods worth 133 francs, property 470 francs.

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial; where accused and most witnesses lived
Location of Prévôt who made initial statement
Home of François Perin who accused Claudon before being executed for witchcraft
Alix was crying on her way to the mill when Claudon consoled her about her pregnancy
Location where Claudon threw the lace-making tool at Lucie's face 2 years before trial
Location of Messire Maurice curé who advised Francois Marchal to empty his bed; late curé of Epinal exorcised someone believed bewitched by Claudon
Pilgrimage site visited by Poirson Batillot on advice of Claudon (to no profit)
Current residence of Margueritte Sellier, wife of maire Gaillat
Thomas Gerardin beat Claudon when he found her with her cows in his field
Claudon confessed to attending sabbat 3 times but recognized no-one there and refused to name accomplices

animal_predation: Witness thought something like a rat was running over bed during illness
economic_hardship_indicators: Disposal of goods worth 133 francs and property 470 francs
Dispute over expenses from sale of goods

legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: Held in prison where she apparently confessed before formal interrogation; guarded in her house by three guards arranged by Thomas Gerardin before arrest order came

hearsay_chains.content: Said some people suggested Claudon might have caused his son's blindness but he had no reason to suspect her other than these comments
Margueritte told him that her husband had been exorcised by the late curé of Epinal when she believed he had been bewitched by Claudon
Advised to empty the bed; Jeannon had previously been bewitched herself
Several curés (Adam of Brantigny, Maurice of Epinal) judged strange things found in beds to be products of witchcraft

emotional_state_notes: Began disposing of possessions when released pending recall
Confessed already in prison before formal interrogation
Resisted pressure to say she had been a witch earlier and had harmed neighbors
Would add nothing of substance in second interrogation
Refused to name any accomplices even under torture

third_parties.name: François Perin
third_parties.context: Executed for witchcraft from Rugney; maintained his accusation against Claudon du Puy up to the time he was burned

third_parties.name: Mongeotte (mother)
third_parties.context: Claudon's mother, also long suspected of witchcraft; quarrelled with Mengin Sauffroy and threatened him; apparently same person as Margueritte du Puix who died a year before trial

third_parties.name: Demenge Pasquin Daviller
third_parties.context: Married to Claudon's sister Margueritte; spending her sister's property and Claudon's own inappropriately; this made Claudon angry, which was the context for her alleged seduction by devil

third_parties.name: Margueritte (sister)
third_parties.context: Claudon lived with her after their mother died; married to Demenge Pasquin Daviller

third_parties.name: Claudon Gerardin
third_parties.relationship_to_witness: brother-in-law of witness 9; husband of witness 15
third_parties.context: Died 8 days after being touched by Claudon while preparing to play cards; death occurred 5 years before trial

third_parties.name: Claude (wife of Francois Marchal)
third_parties.context: Had quarrels with Claudon 11 years earlier when setting up household; Claudon threatened they would not have much luck

third_parties.name: miller's son
third_parties.context: Young man who got Alix pregnant and promised marriage but deserted her

third_parties.name: miller's wife
third_parties.context: Had two stillborn children; Claudon told Alix to pray she would not be like the miller's wife

third_parties.name: Messire Adam (curé)
third_parties.context: Curé of Brantigny who advised that bed be emptied and judged strange things found in it to be products of witchcraft

third_parties.name: Messire Maurice (curé)
third_parties.context: Curé of Epinal who advised Francois Marchal to empty his bed

third_parties.name: late curé of Epinal
third_parties.context: Exorcised maire Gaillat when his wife believed he had been bewitched by Claudon

third_parties.name: Jeannon wife of Grand Colas
third_parties.context: Previously bewitched herself; advised Poirson Batillot to empty the bed during his sister's illness

third_parties.name: Margueritte Sellier
third_parties.context: Wife of maire Gaillat, residing at Hadoville; told George Marchal her husband had been exorcised by late curé of Epinal

third_parties.name: maire Gaillat
third_parties.context: Believed to have been bewitched by Claudon; exorcised by late curé of Epinal

extraction_metadata.notes: Comprehensive extraction from 5-page trial summary. Trial shows extensive community suspicion pattern - 19 witnesses testified, most reporting illnesses, animal deaths, and death of neighbors after quarrels and threats. Claudon was daughter of suspected witch (Mongeotte/Margueritte du Puix). Notable pattern of 'bewitched beds' requiring curé intervention. Claudon confessed early (already in prison) but maintained limited scope - only 9 months as witch, only killed own hens. Refused to name accomplices even under torture. Death sentence followed. Substantial property dispute after execution regarding expenses owed to Thomas Gerardin (partie civile). Two men (Claudon Gerardin 5 years earlier, Claude Gerardin possibly same person) died after being 'touched' by her. Multiple witnesses reported long-term illnesses (3-14 years), animal deaths (horses, cow, unspecified animals), and one stillborn child. Quarrelsome reputation emphasized by multiple witnesses. Economic motivation for seduction: brother-in-law mismanaging family property.
